posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.32 beta soon. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here . If you’d like to get releases even faster, try out Obtainium!

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

★ Now when you link your primary Signal device to a new Desktop or iPad, you can bring your chat history and your last 45 days of media with you. The transfer process is end-to-end encrypted, and completely optional. When it comes to making the choice about whether or not to leave the past behind, you’re left to your own devices.

Complete list of new commits since 7.31.1
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.31.1…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

This release brings the new linked device history syncing (affectionately called “link+sync”) to the wider beta!

If you’re running the latest desktop beta, you should be able to link a new device and transfer your message history to it. Give it a try!

Note the restriction around how we only transfer the last 45 days of media – if you have a long-running desktop install, I don’t necessarily recommend blowing it away to try out this feature.

However, if you are running both prod + beta desktop clients (which I recommend!), then if you wanted to reset your beta client to try it out, that’d be greatly appreciated

Alternatively, if you wanted to test without fear of losing any existing history, you can go check out the builds in our post where we did some advance testing. Those will have separate data storage (like prod and beta) and will therefore let you link another device to try it out.

Speaking of the advanced testing thread – special shout out to all who participated! It was extraordinarily helpful, and it allowed us to find plenty of bugs that we didn’t see internally. So thank you again! I’m always impressed with the kindness and dedication of the people here in the forum

Speaking for Android, I believe I’ve addressed all but one of the bugs I’ve found there, and I’ll be addressing the final one in the 7.32.1 release. However, we expect to find more! So please let us know if you run into any issues.

Even if everything works perfectly, please post a log anyway! It spits out some performance numbers that will let us know if there’s anything we can improve.

Thanks again!

link_counts.title: Get the latest Android releases even faster with Obtainium

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.32.0 (150700)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

33 new commits since 7.31.1:

Show commits

  • Fix and re-enable checkout flow activity tests. [1]

  • Pluralize time strings. [2]

  • Validate sticker IDs during export. [3]

  • Fix editing custom reactions. [4]

  • Improve thread delete performance. [5]

  • MessageBackupsCheckoutFlow free tier happy path. [6]

  • Add happy path for paid subscription UI flow testing. [7]

  • Trim abandoned attachments after backupv1 restore. [8]

  • Update voice note sizing. [9]

  • Preserve some settings after thread deletion. [10]

  • Fix early get self crash when cycling KCS. [11]

  • Migrate linchecks to Kotlin. [12]

    Resolves #13941

  • Filter out some bad data in StorageForcePushJob. [13]

  • Add unit tests for InAppPaymentRecurringContextJob. [14]

  • Update sad paths around manual backup key restore. [15]

  • Pass network change events down to libsignal-net [16]

  • Skip messages that aren't in the right place. [17]

  • Update to libsignal 0.65.4 [18]

  • Fix invalid group authoriziation cache crash. [19]

  • Rotate link+sync capability. [20]

  • Hide report button for Release Notes Channel. [21]

  • Do not export group story replies. [22]

  • Handle additional backup transfer to new phone validation errors. [23]

  • Adjust strings for media and calls. [24]

  • ActiveSubscription state error unit tests for recurring job. [25]

  • Hide waiting to be let in bar when in pip mode. [26]

  • Stop missed call notifications after import. [27]

  • Various backup performance improvements. [28]

  • Fix profile update backup export check. [29]

  • Export all threads, even if inactive. [30]

  • Update translations and other static files. [31]

  • Update baseline profile. [32]

  • Bump version to 7.32.0 [33]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.31.1…v7.32.0

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: CONGRATULATIONS!! This is an amazing feature btw. Is Android → iOS active then?

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
It’s not currently possible to cancel a group join request on Android:

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.32.0/e5ce5cf108036f8211085bbefa6336556ca4901fd7141087976d635fce47fcdd

The cancel request bottom doesn’t show.

Sync worked like a charm!! Thanks again for the great feature and all your work

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.41.0-beta.1/29285638490aec495f0c4b723481e1e066ed28491f28f469e0186f41210a4b7d.gz

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.32.0/2ecedf3917b0c69d210ee234083ab101dad867da668fd37bdb77a32b4c330eca

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
greyson-signal:

Give it a try!

worked like a charm!
after i did all the updates, that is. the link to the beta release on desktop downloaded 7.40, but i didn’t notice that, so i linked, it didn’t work, i only then got the blue update ribbon, i update, it didn’t work again and that’s because my phone was still on 7.31 and i hadn’t noticed
but after that it worked super smoothly. lmk if you’re still looking for debug logs for when it succeeds (i kept those just in case) or if we’re only doing it when it fails now.

posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
rassilon1963:

lmk if you’re still looking for debug logs for when it succeeds

Yep! Logs are still appreciated :) At minimum, it lets us collect some performance numbers to make sure things are meeting our goals in that area. Thanks!

Whatnoww:

Is Android → iOS active then?

“Yes” in that you can link an iPad if you’re on the latest beta :) But we haven’t yet released the full backup feature that will let you move data from one primary device to another primary device.

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
sure!
https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.41.0-beta.1/3d7a74ed8eca800ef5c7971a207d4e0b1a0c4082855f7b8404ebf0c52c570bd3.gz
https://debuglogs.org/android/7.32.0/99d3d300feb945d6e76125d1d06c0fbfca3c9528903006fdf21e08ef154fbc2a

I’m really looking forward to trying out the backup feature !

Months ago I had an iPhone as a primary device, also an iPad and Signal messages were synced. I replaced the iPhone with an Android phone and have yet to use Signal on it, as I read back then it wasn’t possible for message history sync.

There’s constant talk about primary device and desktop being seperate, but I’m not sure where an iPad stands here. Will I be able to transfer the Signal message history (that’s still being used) from the iPad to the Android device ? If so, what feature should I be looking out for and what should or shouldn’t I do ?

Tested the linked device with the latest beta of Android and desktop.
Worked flawless.
Anyway here are the debuglogs:

Desktop:
https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.41.0-adhoc.20250129.22-48da36376/3aa967537ad034cdebb6125dc9e6c07db0e9b8b71b0bc7224547ba0a922b8d6f.gz

Android:
https://debuglogs.org/android/7.32.0/6c3c3fa4d5a6cac4c50687d58561022310e20ac3fddd06f8bf6af07ab925c2dd

Tested the sync from Android to macOS, and it worked flawlessly except for the fact that I no longer get the option to name the device, and it just defaulted to macOS.

Thanks for the amazing update!

posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
Siusco:

Will I be able to transfer the Signal message history (that’s still being used) from the iPad to the Android device ?

We have plans to allow restoring from a linked device, but we’re treating that as a separate project from this link+sync feature, as well as separate from the initial launch of cross-platform backups. Figuring out how to restore a primary from a linked device is mostly a UX issue (these devices can already export a backup, just tricky for various reasons how to restore it), and we didn’t want to complicate the initial launches.

posts.name: anon53652
posts.cooked: Will this also support Android as a linked device in the future?

Archived conversations are returning after 1 sec.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.32.1/97cab9568a979113f8deb8fe04f112be09501239cf73f3a7bde013cd52090bc7

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
pachungulo:

and it worked flawlessly except for the fact that I no longer get the option to name the device, and it just defaulted to macOS.

that’s intentional.

Help us test desktop history syncing!
Help us test desktop history syncing!

The new device is automatically named “Linux”. If I select to not sync my history to the desktop, I’m asked for the device name.

Yep, this is intentional! We decided to remove the step of requiring the user to name a device so that the linking process can be totally automatic after the QR code is scanned and approved. We also figure that almost all users only have one linked device anyway, so asking for a name was just kind of annoying. Thankfully, we added the feature to rename a device (tap the three-dot menu next to a device on the linked device screen), so you can change it afterwards if you’d like!

(20 chars)
